programme.title: Giant Grizzlies
programme.desc: Join Andreas Kieling and a native Alaskan on a dangerous expedition through Alaska’s grizzly territories.

programme.title: The Horse Tamer With Pat Parelli
programme.desc: Grace bought her quarterhorse Bella specifically for riding, but Bella doesn't seem to want anyone to ride. Pat is here to help Grace and to make Bella feel safer for generations of Grace's family.

programme.title: The Horse Tamer With Pat Parelli
programme.desc: Pat meets with Mary, who has had her horse Milo for 3 years. Mary was told that he was rideable, but that turned out not to be the case. Milo is smart, but also unpredictable and Mary needs some help.

programme.title: Bear Whisperer
programme.desc: In this episode, big black bears are rumbling into town, but even they must respect the Bear Whisperer.

programme.title: Bear Whisperer
programme.desc: In this episode, three young bears show up in the town of Mammoth Lakes without their mothers.

programme.title: Bear Whisperer
programme.desc: The Bear Whisperer uses aversion therapy to teach the bears that bad behavior results in punishment.

programme.title: Otters: River Masters of Yellowstone
programme.desc: Follow two families of river otters in Yellowstone and how they join together to face small challenges.

programme.title: Giants Of Fortune - The Whale Sharks Of Oslob
programme.desc: Typhoons and overfishing in Oslob, a Filipino village, have severely affected fishermen

programme.title: Great White Shark: New Perspectives on an Ancient Predator
programme.desc: Top divers and shark scientists come to a pivotal moment in the understanding of the Great White.

programme.desc: Follow the story of a moose mother fiercely defending her calf from danger

programme.desc: The film follows Buck, an Alpine Ibex from Italy's Gran Paradiso, highlighting his life and majestic beauty.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: 320 million years ago, dragonflies and centipedes were human-sized, unlike today's tiny insects.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: New fossils in China reveal prehistoric feathered beasts and giant insects, including large dragonflies.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: China fossils show prehistoric mammals evolved 35 million years ago, with more diversity and abundance.

programme.title: Dinosaurs: On the trail of Pre-History
programme.desc: Scientists aim to uncover a lost, extinct world hidden in sandstone for over 140 million years.

programme.title: Vanishing Dragons
programme.desc: This film investigates the decline in marine iguanas and tries to determine what can stop their extinction.

programme.title: Myths of the Great White
programme.desc: The great white shark is one of the world's most vilified predators. Its maligned public image arises from occasionally attacking humans, but more importantly by its popular portrayal as a man-eater.

programme.title: Sharks, Scavengers Of The Sea
programme.desc: New Caledonia's lagoon is a shark paradise, where they scavenge feathers, fins, and fur for prey.

programme.title: White Wolf
programme.desc: Filmed in Yellowstone National Park, this film follows the packs of two rare alpha female White Wolves.

programme.desc: This documentary reveals some of the most astonishing behaviors of Grizzly bears.

programme.desc: Germany's Wild Wolves challenges modern myths about wolves, revealing their social structures
